sentence.Network_en: They wanted a pretext for subduing the region by force.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们想找借口用武力征服这个地区。

sentence.Network_en: They would now find some dubious pretext to restart the war.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们现在会找个蹩脚的借口重新发动战争。

sentence.Network_en: The incident was used as a pretext for intervention in the area.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次事件成了干涉那个地区的借口。

英语六级考试必备核心词汇3 - 豆丁网 ... presume vt. 假定，假设，揣测 pretext n. 借口,托辞 prevalent a. 流行的；盛行的.
NewWords ... 党风建设 construction of the Party conduct 挡箭牌 excuse;pretext 当前用户 active user.

list.abs: one even hinted that some billboards might be taken down on the pretext that they were poorly made and might fall and cause accidents .某官员甚至以某些广告牌制作粗糙，可能会掉落从而导致意外事故发生为借口，暗示这些广告牌应该被撤掉。
A defendant shall not be deprived on any pretext of his right to appeal., 对被告人的上诉权 , 不得以任何借口加以剥夺.
He procrastinated his return on various pretexts ., 他以各种借口拖延归期.
he required a pretext to participate in Soviet Bureaucratic decisions was to elevate chutzpah into an art form .他需要找个借口才能参与苏联官僚机构的决定，不过是把厚颜无耻打扮得漂亮些罢了。
Luoxi Bridge is a pretext to continue to charge fees that works ?, 洛溪大桥继续收费说修整是否找个借口来收费?

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Latin praetextus 'outward display', from the verb praetexere 'to disguise', from prae 'before' + texere 'weave'

entry.def: A pretext is a reason which you pretend has caused you to do something.

example.ex: They wanted a pretext for subduing the region by force...
example.tran: 他们想找借口用武力征服这个地区。

example.ex: He excused himself on the pretext of a stomach upset...
example.tran: 他借口自己胃不舒服离开了。

means.word_mean: 1. something serving to conceal plans; a fictitious reason that is concocted in order to conceal the real reason

sentences.sentence: "under the guise of friendship he betrayed them"

auth_sentence.content: The Romantics invented invalidism as a pretext for leisure.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Romantics invented invalidism as a pretext for leisure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Romantics invented invalidism as a pretext for leisure.

auth_sentence.content: But analysts said this dispute was merely a pretext.
auth_sentence.res_content: But analysts said this dispute was merely a pretext.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But analysts said this dispute was merely a pretext.

auth_sentence.content: You launch a blistering attack using any pretext.
auth_sentence.res_content: You launch a blistering attack using any pretext.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You launch a blistering attack using any pretext.

stems_affixes.value_cn: [文章等]前后关系;[事件等发生的]背景
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+text编织→共同编织在一起的
pre预先+text编织→预先编好的→借口
text[n.正文,文本;原文;教科书]+book书→n.教科书, 课本

stems_affixes.value_cn: [织物]质地;[材料]构造;结构;肌理
stems_affixes.word_buile: text编织+ure表名词→编织的状态→结构

Sentence.sentence: College faculty members are afraid that the pretext of moving students into the workforce might pose a threat to the core curriculum.

sentences.en: He used his headache as a pretext for not going to school.
sentences.cn: 他借口头疼而不去上学。

jushi.english: He used his headache as a pretext for not going to school.
jushi.chinese: 他借口头疼而不去上学。
